tasks.task: Conducting research on the integration of cover crops and manure for soil health and crop yield improvement in the upper Midwest.
subtasks: Designing experimental plots with randomized complete log design.
Applying manure either in early or late fall using sweep injection.
Applying urea in the spring when necessary.
Planting cover crops (winter rye and annual rye grass mixtures) using broadcast seeding technique at the V5 corn growth stage.
Alternatively, drilling cover crops after corn harvest.
Measuring cover crop biomass in the late fall and spring.
Analyzing the impact of manure application timing and cover crop techniques on corn yield.
Examining nutrient source effects on cover crop biomass and corn yield.
Evaluating the role of cover crops in nutrient cycling and soil health.

tasks.task: Presenting research findings through a poster.
subtasks: Discussing challenges in cover crop adoption in the upper Midwest.
Highlighting the objectives and methods of the study.
Exemplifying the experimental setup and treatment combinations.
Presenting preliminary data on cover crop biomass and corn yields.
Addressing the interaction between manure application and cover crops.
Sharing the significance of the findings for agricultural practices.
Acknowledging grant programs and organizations funding the research.
Expressing gratitude to research centers and labs.
